DataElement.preferredName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale 11 Past Week How Often Sleep Was Restless Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation in the past week how often their sleep was restless, using a four-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale Past Week How Often Sleep Was Restless Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-test that measures depressive feelings and behaviors within the general population._The most recent week, including today._A question about the frequency of an event or behavior._A question about whether an individual's sleep is or was restless._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-test that measures depressive feelings and behaviors within the general population.

Concepts.longName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale
Concepts.definition: A self-test that measures depressive feelings and behaviors within the general population.

Property.preferredName: Past Week How Often Sleep is Restless Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.:A question about whether an individual's sleep is or was restless.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.
A question about whether an individual's sleep is or was restless.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: CES-D:Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale. Radloff, L.S., Applied Psychological Measurement, 1:385-401, 1977.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale Score 4 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Rarely or None of the Time ) to 3 (Most or All of the Time) on a Likert scale used on the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Most or Almost All of the Time

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Most or Almost All of the Time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something happens or happened most or almost most of the time.

Concepts.longName: Most or Almost All of the Time
Concepts.definition: An indication that something happens or happened most or almost most of the time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Moderately or Much of the Time

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Moderately or Much of the Time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something happens or happened moderately or much of the time.

Concepts.longName: Moderately or Much of the Time
Concepts.definition: An indication that something happens or happened moderately or much of the time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Some or a Little of the Time

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Some or a Little of the Time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened a small amount of the time but not often.

Concepts.longName: Some or a Little of the Time
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened a small amount of the time but not often.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Rarely or None of the Time

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Rarely or None of the Time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened never or almost never.

Concepts.longName: Rarely or None of the Time
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened never or almost never.
